Context:
Program Name: Computer Systems Technician
Code: T141
Credential: Ontario College Diploma
Duration: 2 years (4 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,236.00
International Tuition: $17,880.00
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Computer Technology
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Method of Study: Full-time
Program Delivery: Hybrid (Semester 1 and 4) / On Campus (Semester 3) for Fall 2023
                         Hybrid for Winter 2024 (Semesters 1, 2, and 4)
Program Description: IT sector is growing in Toronto with skills shortages. George Brown College's Computer Systems Technician program provides students with a broad technical base through courses in system support, network administration, and web technologies.
Industry Recognition: Cisco Networking Academy with Premier Partner status for two consecutive years.
Related Programs: Computer Systems Technology (T147), Computer Programming and Analysis (T177), Cyber Security (Postgraduate) (T433)

Context: The Computer Systems Technician program at George Brown College lasts for two years and covers areas of system support, network administration, and web technologies. Students have access to up-to-date networking, wireless, and security lab equipment with 24/7 remote access through the NetLab platform. Graduates are prepared to write several industry certification exams and may be employed in IT units throughout private and public sectors as computer system technicians or supervisors. The program requires a personal computer with specifications: minimum 16 GB RAM, 256 GB SSD Hard Drive (500+ GB is optimal), Quad-core i7 2.4GHz or better, video card (minimum 2GB RAM/recommended 4GB RAM), and a webcam. Students starting the program in January may be required to attend classes during summer months. The curriculum includes courses such as COMP 1151 - IT Essentials, COMP 1236 - Fundamentals of Computing Logic, COMP 1234 - Introduction To Web Development, and more. Opportunities to receive transfer credits for further study towards a degree are available.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Computer Systems Technician Program T141 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text provides information about the courses offered in different semesters by the college under various departments like COMP, MATH, and GNED. Here's a list of factual information extracted from the text:

1. Courses offered in Semester 2:
   - COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts
   - COMP 1176: Introduction to Networks
   - COMP 3044: Linux Essentials
   - COMP 1250: Introduction to Programming
   - COMP 3105: Enterprise Desktop Operating Systems
   - MATH 1172: Mathematics for Computer Technology II
   - GNED: General Education Elective

2. Courses offered in Semester 3:
   - COMP 3136: Network Infrastructure
   - COMP 2064: Identity Management Services
   - COMP 2155: Network Automation
   - COMP 2148: Professional Workplace Competencies
   - COMP 3066: Linux System Administration
   - GNED: General Education Elective

3. Courses offered in Semester 4:
   - COMP 3138: Enterprise Networking and Automation
   - COMP 2102: Wireless Technology Fundamentals
   - COMP 2141: Windows Server Network Infrastructure
   - COMP 2156: DevOps For System Administration
   - COMP 3061: Cyber Security Fundamentals

4. Placement test results may require taking COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) before progressing to COMM 2000, and students will be charged for this extra course.

5. General Education Electives are part of the program requirements.

6. The graduate is expected to demonstrate abilities related to:
   - Identifying, analyzing, developing, implementing, verifying, and documenting computing environment requirements
   - Contributing to technical problem diagnostics, troubleshooting, documenting, and monitoring using appropriate methodologies and tools
   - Implementing and maintaining secure computing environments
   - Creating robust computing system solutions through validation testing that aligns with industry best practices
   - Communicating and collaborating effectively with team members and stakeholders
   - Selecting strategies for personal and professional development to enhance work performance
   - Adhering to ethical, legal, and regulatory requirements in the development and management of computing solutions and systems
   - Assisting with computer system implementation
   - Installing, configuring, troubleshooting, maintaining, upgrading, and decommissioning computing system infrastructures
   - Automating routine tasks using scripting tools and programming languages
   - Providing technical support for computing system infrastructures that aligns with industry best practices
   - Implementing the basic concept, principles, and scope of DevOps.

Context:
The text provides information about a program offered at George Brown College, including:

1. DevOps Concepts: DevOps implementation with industry best practices, principles, and scope. Task automation using configuration management and the Cloud. Automation of network administrative tasks across distributed clients.
2. Tuition & Fees: Domestic tuition is $4,236.00 for the first two semesters starting Fall 2022, and international tuition is $17,880.00 for the same period. The fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2023 and later dates.
3. Financial Assistance: Approved for OSAP funding for eligible applicants.
4. Admission Requirements: Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, grade 12 English (C or U), and grade 11 Math (M or U) or grade 12 (C or U). Mature students may apply with an Admissions Assessment for English and math or consider upgrading. Meeting the minimum requirements does not guarantee admission to the program.
5. Course Exemptions: College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions.
6. Application Process: Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students need more information on the International Admissions page.

There is no explicit mention of a specific program name in the text.

Context: International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. The Computer Systems Technician program is offered through the School of Computer Technology from Casa Loma Campus at 146 Kendal Avenue. Contact the Program Co-ordinator Maziar Masoudi at ext. 3345 or email mmasoudi@georgebrown.ca for more information. The office hours are Monday – Friday: 9 a.m. – 4 p.m. For international students, contact one of the international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page. Other related programs include Computer Systems Technology (T147), Computer Programming and Analysis (T177), and Cyber Security (Postgraduate) (T433). You can sign up for an information session or campus tour, book a campus tour, get answers to your questions by booking an info session, and sign up to receive tailored resources to make your application. The contact details for the college are: Phone: 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.
